intro: Afrobrunnichia africana, commonly known as the African brunnichia, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Afrobrunnichia africana is adapted to dry conditions, making it a hardy species found in various habitats across its native range.
